messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] telephone solisitors got ya down??? try this
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/24/00 6:34:56 PM US Mountain Standard Time, ... I ... My mom was asked this into her 50s. She used to say, I don t know, you could call
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/24/00 6:34:56 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
HollyAtch@... writes:

> My favorite is when they ask to speak to my "mommie" Im 26! I very
> politely tell them that "No my mommie isn't here right now thank you" and
I
> hang up.

My mom was asked this into her 50s. She used to say, "I don't know, you could
call her." Then she started saying, "No, she died, can I help you?"

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] telephone solisitors got ya down??? try this
messages.msgSnippet: My favorite is when they ask to speak to my mommie  Im 26!  I very politely tell them that No my mommie isn t here right now thank you and I hang up. ...
messages.messageBody:
My favorite is when they ask to speak to my "mommie" Im 26! I very
politely tell them that "No my mommie isn't here right now thank you" and I
hang up.

>this is so funny, Carol, saying ~> *HE LOCKS ME UP!!! <VBG>!!! ... one
>time a ph sol ask "if they can speak w/ the person who PAYS THE BILLS!!!"
>I said *NOOOOO, I'M *JUST* THE MAID!!!* and THEY hung up!!! tee~hee ...
>
>Pris

>----- Original Message -----
>From: <sognokids@...>
>To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
>Sent: Friday, June 23, 2000 8:25 PM
>Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] telephone solisitors got ya down??? try
>this
>
>
> > What bugs me about telephone solicitors is when I get a call for my
>husband
> > when he's not home. Then I am often asked if I am ***authorized*** to
>make
> > decisions regarding phone service or credit cards. In a trembling
>voice,
>I
> > always tell them I am not authorized to make any decisions; in fact, my
> > husband keeps me locked in the basement when he's not home.
> >
> > They never call back!
> >
> > Carol
>
